fields.description:
We have been using the Classic boards but as these are now on the chopping block I'm looking at the new boards.

The new burndown graph is too noisy and is confusing for some stake holders/managers who used to occasionally check burndown charts on the Classic boards.

I have a team of 11 who are, fortunately, very good at logging time - this means that during the day there's a very tight clustering of data points, which makes it almost impossible to meaningfully inspect the points, but that's then followed by a flatline representing out of office hours. 

If there was an OPTION to consolidate each day in to a single data point that'd be ideal. I've attached a screenshot of the classic vs new chart (using same team data, though sprint for new chart starts a day later).
fields.summary: Option to simplify Burndown chart to a single daily data point (like the Classic boards)

fields.description: The 'Cumulative Flow Diagram' has the option to 'Refine report' where it can use quick filters ... a similar interface on the burndown chart would work fantastically.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master I would like Quick Filters available on the burndown chart

fields.description:
I have a project with 3 teams, we have been using the Classic boards but as these are now on the chopping block I'm looking at the new boards.

I am using the multiple sprint functionality, but the problem comes when completing the sprint.

Say I have active sprints 'A1' and 'B1', then during the sprint I'm doing some planning for the next sprint which are 'A2' and 'B2', when I release A1 on my sprint planning day all the work will drop in to the top future sprint (A2), but when I release B1 that too will drop in to A2.

When I release a sprint I need the option to define which bucket unfinished tasks are going to fall in to, just like the Classic Boards supported.
fields.summary: When running multiple sprints, I need to be able to specify which future sprint incomplete work is moved to

fields.description:
Original summary: "As a user, it would be great to include 'Remaining Estimate and Time Spent' in 'Workload by Assignee' summary"
---

The "Workload by Assignee" summary only calculate *Estimation Statistic* but not *'Time Tracking'* such as *'Remaining Estimate and Time Spent'*. 

As the summary does not include time estimated against subtasks, the results will confuse some users ("This says I've got 4h work, but I've got 20h in subtasks.")

To hide the summary, please add the following JavaScript into the JIRA Announcement Banner:
{code}
<style>
div.ghx-assigned-work-stats
{display:none}
</style>
{code}
fields.summary: Ability to see 'Remaining Estimate' in 'Workload by Assignee' summary

fields.description:
As a scrum master, I would like the burndown legend to be moved off the chart so I can see the burndown (or should I just say "burn" - not so much "down") line no matter how poorly the team is doing.

I've attached a screen shot of three charts laid out side-by-side on a three-column dashboard. You can see how the legend is covering the red burndown line on two of the three charts.

Ideas:
 The legend could be an on-off toggle, since most people who are looking know what they are looking at.
 The legend could display in that unused white space below.
 Legend could be a "tool tip" (not good for wallboards)

* I would love to see the left column on the main dashboard page (that copies the same list of dashboards in the pulldown) go away, to give more horizontal space on the dashboard page, and this could have an effect on  whether the line is covered.
* Would love the option to hide non-working days (like there used to be, and is on the boards page).
* I always used the old option to hide the guideline as well. (Less confusing for the higher-ups.)
fields.summary: Legend on the Agile Sprint Burndown Gadget covers red burndown line

fields.description: For example, I have one ticket in the backlog, I moved it to open and I need to set 5 days to be done. In the 5th day I need it to change to yellow color automatically, after 5 days if it is not done I need it to be changed to red color automatically.
fields.summary: As a user, it would be great Kanban board could show issue with different color when due date is near or exceeded

fields.description:
With version 6.6 it is possible to add up to 3 fields to the cards (GHS-3922).
Other than in GreenHopper Classic this results in an extra line per card and in less number of cards fitting on the screen.

It would be good if the user could decide with a single mouse click, if the cards show the custom fields or not.

This could be achieved by simply adding a check-box right-sided to the "QUICK FILTERS"
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to toggle the display of custom fields on the card

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11160].
  {panel}

Updated summary - was "Add "Disable Detail View" option to Agile Board User Preferences"

---

As a developer, I would like to NOT have the detail view pop-up when selecting a card on an Agile board so that I don't loose screen real-estate by showing details I don't want to see, because I typically open the issue in a new browser tab to see all of the details and/or make edits anyway.

As a SCRUM Master, I would like the detail view to display so that I don't have to continuously open new tabs to view each issue when discussing issues as a team in the daily standup.

As can be seen, the role of the user plays a significant part in how this feature is typically used.  The proposed "solution" is to make the display of the detail a USER PREFERENCE that can be enabled or disabled per board (either Kanban or Scrum)

Similar to GHS-10182 - however, that request wanted to make it an ADMIN function to disable the detail view per board, which does not fit with a sub-set of users.
fields.summary: Ability to select issues without the Detail View opening

fields.description: We have a fairly complex workflow, with 6+ transitions per status.  However, most of these are low use actions, which are used for categorization(lower/raise priority, change versions, etc.)  With JIRA 5 these were not displayed in JIRA Agile (I'm assuming because they were global loopback (-1) transtions.)  JIRA 6 starts to show them now, and it's a bit of a headache.  As you can see in the attachment, it makes the board less usable.  Of the six actions in the screenshot, the only one we wish to have exposed to the board is the 'Stop Work' action.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user, I would like to be able to hide certain transitions on a board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11157].
  {panel}

When in Plan mode of a board, you can easily create a new issue using the *+ Create issue* link.

If you use that link, type the issue summary and then hit the _Enter_ button, the issue will automatically be created in the respective sprint or backlog chosen. This is good but you will not be able to configure other fields. To edit other fields, you will have to click the *...* button on the right (beside the Cancel button).

However, if you use the *...* button, the _Create new issue_ screen will pop up. In this screen, the sprint field will not be populated with any value. When created, the issue will enter the backlog.

It would be better if the field in the screen is automatically populated with the sprint which the *+ Create issue* sprint is used.
fields.summary: Automatically populate the Sprint field when using the "+ Create issue" link in Plan mode

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Contrary to [*JRA-14810* Sub-tasks quick creation for should inherit the components of the parent issue for new sub-tasks|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-14810], creating a Technical Task from a *Story* issue type inherit the parent's component value

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Install *JIRA Agile*
# Create JIRA Agile *project*
# Add a *Component(s)* to the project
# Create *issue* with issue type *Story* and populate the component field
# Create a *Technical Task* (sub-task) from the issue
# Leave the Component field *blank*

h4. Expected Results
Component value from parent is not inherited

h4. Actual Results
Component value from parent is inherited

h4. Notes
*Technical Sub-task* came with JIRA Agile, not with the JIRA default sub-task
fields.summary: Technical Task (sub-task) creation from Issue Type Story inherit Parent's Component

fields.description:
Currently when completing sprint all issues that return to backlog are reindexed two times.

LexoRankService should become a low level API (LexoRankManager).

Then RankService is  high level API - it calls LexoRankManager.rankXxx() followed by re-index.

That way when completing sprint LexoRankManager could be called without reindexing.
fields.summary: Remove unnecessary indexing on sprint complete.

fields.description:
GHS-6866 and GHS-9808 already describe the case for "I want to create an issue and automatically add it to the current sprint". With Agile 6.4.2, I already get the small hint "Your issue was created, but is currently not visible." along with a "Add to <currently active sprint name>".

In most cases, follow-up tickets shouldn't go to the current sprint, but to the next one (in rare cases; to a planned one that isn't the next following sprint). We'll still do a review before starting the next sprint, but that way we could schedule tasks in advance without leaving the Work board.

I could imagine something like this:
{panel}Your issue was created, but is currently not visible.
{color:blue}+Add to 4.2.0.3+{color}, {color:blue}+schedule for 4.2.0.4+{color}, {color:blue}+schedule for 4.2.0-finalization+{color}{panel}
fields.summary: As a sprint planner, I would like to schedule a newly created issue; just like I can add it to the current sprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11149].
  {panel}

When updating the Epic Link field of an issue no webhook event is fired.

To reproduce:

Enable all webhooks for issues - no custom JQL
Create an Epic (webhook fired)
Create a Story with no Epic Link (webhook fired)
Edit Story to add Epic Link (no webhook fired)

Expected behavior:
A webhook event of type jira:issue_updated would be fired for the Story
fields.summary: Webhook not fired when updating Epic Link of an issue

fields.description:
When configuring columns for an Agile Board:

Sometimes, you can have a ton of unmapped statuses that may apply to your board.  Having too many unmapped statuses is another issue buuuut....

It would be nice, when scrolling down to the get the respective unmapped status, that the Column "headers" float with you so that you won't lose track of which column you wanted to map the status to to begin with.
fields.summary: Agile Board Configure Columns - Floating Column Header when Scrolling

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to access an Epic would be to either open up the story and click on the Epic Link, or to use the Epic Panel on the left to 'View in JIRA'.

However, If you have a lot of epics you often can’t see the epic on the left side. 

But you can see the story in the backlog with the needed epic link. Hence, it would be really useful if the Epic can be accessed directly via the Epic Link in the Planning board :

!epic link.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allow users to directly access Epic via Epic Link in Planning board

fields.description:
The "QUICK FILTERS" line in Kanban board (work mode) should be place in the same line as the board name line.
We usually use laptop with small screen height. The board header lines should be keep minimize!
fields.summary: The "QUICK FILTERS" line in Kanban board (work mode) should be place in the same line as the board name line

fields.description:
If we add a custom issue icon with bigger resolution size, Scrum board shows it at full resolution. Issue icons should be at 16x16px but if user adds an icon with bigger resolution(like 100x100px) the display of icon becomes at 100x100px.

Steps to reproduce:

- add 100x100px icon to an issue type
- create a scrum board
- configure scrum board as "story" is the base swimlane
- scrum board shows icon at full resolution.

Adding these styles resolves the problem:

.ghx-swimlane-header .ghx-type img {
  ...
  width: 16px;
  ...
}
fields.summary: Scrum board shows too big icons if issue has custom icons with bigger resolution

fields.description: Currently Agile charts such as the Burndown Chart can not be configured to exclude non-working *hours*. There should be a configurable work hour setting similar to the Working Days setting.
fields.summary: Configurable work hours for Agile charts

fields.description:
An issue we are facing is that the Product Owner has trouble identifying new items that need ranking, and as such they they get lost in the middle of the backlog. Especially when they are created whilst the Planning Board is open.

As a workaround...
 I am using colour and status to indicate an item has not yet been ranked.
 This way all 'new' items show up. However this requires the Product Owner to transition these items/issues after they haver been ranked, which is clumsy.

On our physical wall, we have a separate section where all new cards are posted until they are ranked.
 It has a green heading called "New Items".
When the Product Owner reviews the backlog, any "New Items" are ranked.

What I would like to see is a similar tool avalible in Jira.
 e.g. a separate section of the Planning Board, where new items are quaranteened, until physically dragged into a position in the backlog.

I could see this being implemented by not auto-assigning issues a rank.

For backwards compatiility I see this as a configurable feature, so as not to shock product owners on upgrade.
fields.summary: As a Product Owner, I want new PBIs quarantined from the Backlog until I rank them

fields.description:
Froom Deb Morrison at Virgin Australia:

About 2 months ago there was an upgrade on the Jira Scrum Board site to reduce the space in scrum cards.  This is really ideal for large plasma screens where you can simply Ctrl and scroll down with your mouse – then you can see the whole title.  Unfortunately on a 1024x768 desktop monitor, this makes it even tinier and unreadable and is impacting our ability to read cards on our board.
 
Can you please consider reverting the changes back?
fields.summary: Revert font/space changes on scrum board cards

fields.description: The assignee icons should be configurable to be shown or hidden on cards in the Plan Mode.
fields.summary: Allow to disable assignee icons on cards in Plan Mode

fields.description:
Jira bulk change is not working as expected, it throws an error (see attached) under the sprint field and prevents you from completing the bulk.

# Select tickets in the "Plan" mode under Jira Agile (Scrum Mode)
# Right-hand click and select the "Bulk Change" option
# User is taken to the bulk update screen (see screenshot)
# Note that error under the "Sprint Field" (see screenshot). Have attached the entire error under the text field
# User removes error and replaces it with desired sprint ID.
# User tries to bulk update and gets a 500 error
fields.summary: Bulk change is not working as expected when user wants to bulk update the "Sprint" field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11130].
  {panel}

Epics are not displayed as other tickets in the Plan tab, inside Sprints. 

Having said that, I can simply edit an Epic and add it to any Sprint I have.
I can also have a Story inside a Sprint, change it's issue type to Epic and it will remain associated to the Sprint.

Since the main purpose of Epics is to have a "larger user story" across multiple sprints, I believe there's no reason why you should be able to add it to a sprint, or keep it in one when moved from Story to Epic.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile should prevent Epics being added to Sprints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11129].
  {panel}

* Create an Issue in the planning mode of a scrum board
* The issue counts towards resolved issues in the project overview, because the resolved date is set

Workaround:
When you start to work on the issue the resolved date disappears.
fields.summary: Creating an Issue in the Agile Board sets resolved date

fields.description: User would like to have an configuration option for Epic Name to synchronize with the issue summary. Thus, it would help kept the Epic Name in sync with summary and avoid wrong naming confusion from users.
fields.summary: Option for Epic Name to Sync with Issue Summary

fields.description:
The burndown chart of jira agile shows the issues as small circles that you can click to see the tooltip showing some information.
Unfortunately the tooltip doesn't have any clickable link to the issue. It would be very beneficial if we could click on the circle and navigate to that issue or if we could configure the information displayed in the tooltip.
!burndown chart.jpg!
fields.summary: As a user, I want the small circles on the Burndown Chart to be clickable

fields.description:
As a Agile sprint planner, I want to see the sum of the task and subtasks time in the bullet field when planning my sprint

When in a board, "work" panel, and agile configured as "Estimation statistic" based on estimate and time tracking activated, I want to see the sum of the subtasks and task time in the bullet of the backlog.
fields.summary: As an Agile sprint planner, I want to see the sum of the task and subtasks time in the bullet field when planning my sprint

fields.description:
As a Agile sprint planner, I want to see the remaining time in the bullet field when planning my sprint.

When in a board, "work" panel, and agile configured as "Estimation statistic" based on estimate and time tracking activated, I want to see the remaining time in place of the original estimated time in the bullet of the backlog.

Because I want to be able to plan an issue reopened based on the remaining time and not on the original estimated.
fields.summary: As a Agile sprint planner, I want to see the remaining time in the bullet field when planning my sprint
Error page when clicking on Agile feedback

fields.description: Some customers cannot use Labs features, they can only use "officially supported" features.
fields.summary: Move Parallel Sprints feature out of JIRA Software (Agile) Labs

fields.description:
UX fail = Not showing that me as an admin can edit the fields on the board. 

In fecru project, we all want to be able to re-configure our board when new versions are released. Essentially we just want to update the current filter query with new versions. 

Since all is board admin, I expect all to be able to do that, but since filters are only editable by owners of the filters, this is not possible.

Reading the comments on this page suggests that there are more people after this.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Shared+Filters

I guess would be related to this issue as well:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-17783

See screenshot
fields.summary: UX fail on board admin when multiple people administrating same board
Improve inline issue create to work when the board has more than one project

fields.description:
Unless I'm missing something, there is no way to change a sprint completion date once you click "Complete Sprint". Unfortunately mistakes do happen and this screws up reporting.

Could this please be added?

Since there is no UI to change the Sprint *Complete Date*, it would be great to have the ability to change it through REST API as a workaround.
fields.summary: Add ability to change sprint completion date (agile board)

fields.description:
When we go to any of our boards, the summary text of all the tickets is just showing up in the left-hand portion of the card so it is very difficult to get enough of the summary to understand the ticket without hovering over it.

I have attached a screenshot of one of our boards demonstrating the problem.

Note: we are using JIRA on-demand/cloud/etc.
fields.summary: Ticket summary showing only on left portion of card when displayed on board

fields.description: We have a hosted instance of Jira. The URL is https://radiusinc.atlassian.net/. Last night when I logged into Jira the Agile plug-in did not load. I went to the plug-in section and saw an error message that the add-on failed to enable. I searched Jira and found where a user reported a similar issue and the resolution was apparently to restart the instance.
fields.summary: Jira Agile Plug-in Will not Load

fields.description:
A number of our teams who are using the Agile and Kanban boards find it difficult to manage their sprint backlogs when in the *work* mode. If there are a large amount of issues in the first "To do" column, and a number at the bottom should in fact be worked on first, they have to click, drag and scroll using various awkward mouse movements countless times.

It would make a lot of sense to introduce similar functionality to what the Plan view contains, like the "Top of Backlog" option in the right click popup; but instead a "Top of Sprint" option. 

This could be visible only in the work mode, or in fact both Plan and Work depending on your design requirements.
fields.summary: Send to top of sprint should be available in the right click popup for Work View (Kanban and Agile)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11107].
  {panel}

This defect was copied as we are having the exact same issue as of last night. We cannot access the jira plug-in as we are getting an error that it is failing to load. If you review the logs you will see that 'com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira' failed to load. Also, prior to that error there is another entry that 'jira-greenhooper-plugin-6.5.23....' failed to load. 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The JIRA Agile appears to be disabled. Under the JIRA Agile add-on if you try to enable it, you hit into error: This add-on failed to enable. It may require a license. Refer to the logs for more information. 

The current *workaround* is to *restart the instance*. If you are raising an issue, under https://support.atlassian.com, do let us know the best time to restart your instance.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile tab is missing from the instance

fields.description:
per https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-106792

this customer generated unusual amounts of traffic during a period of time on their OnDemand instance

it seems to have come from repeated loadings of the images outlined in the JST ticket

this level of traffic was unusual enough that it stood out to the service operations, team which we investigated and eventually raised that JST

is there a known issue with the kanban export process that would result in this sort of behavior? This is why I am raising this as a bug ticket - I am a little hesitant to think that this behavior is expected

if this isn't the right place for this ticket then feel free to move it to wherever it should be
fields.summary: Unusual traffic generated on OnDemand instance due to excel export of kanban board

fields.description: Agile Scrum "Subtasks" Can not Backlog Sprint
fields.summary: Agile Scrum Subtasks Can not Backlog Sprint

fields.description:
For some reason in OD we get time out on createProject. Either we should find out why project import is so slow(>60 seconds) or refactor WelcomeResource to use TaskManager.

More details:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-9965
fields.summary: Creating sample project and board timeout

fields.description:
With this new version, we've avatars showing on planning board. It would be a great improvement to:
- Show this avatars on working board and clicking on it, select only issues affected to this user
- Also, it would web a great improvement to have a multiselect of issue status, to select all issues resolved, or any status defined on the workflow of the project
fields.summary: Add assignee avatars to work mode and allow per user filtering when clicking them

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11097].
  {panel}

I am using evaluation license for agile board
I try to create a board and listed the issues from project
created the sprint and in plan menu I could view the issues 
I moved the status of the issues to in progress and went back to the board work menu I could not see the issues listed there in in-progress area
similarly when the issue status is moved to done, On agile board work menu
no issues were listed need help to configure the agile board
fields.summary: Issues are not listing in in progress or done section of the board in Work menu

fields.description:
Our "Goods Deal Automation Sprints" Agile Board has Seth Gilligan (sgilligan) as the Board Owner.  Seth is no longer with the company and therefore I need to transfer ownership of this Board over to me.  Can you please provide me that access?

This Board can be found linked to the Project "Goods Deal Automation" (GDA) and this is the URL - https://bugs.groupondev.com/secure/RapidView.jspa?rapidView=440.
fields.summary: Change ownership of Agile Board

fields.description:
Hello,

In my JIRA Agile Scrum Board I have set my Estimation Time Tracking preference to _Remaining Estimate and Time Spent_ however when viewing the Epic Burndown chart it appears to only support burning down via the Original Estimate.

So, as an Agile user I would like the Epic Burndown chart to honor my Scrum board's Time Tracking preference so that I can see time being burned down when my developers log time against a ticket within the epic, and not just when the ticket is closed / original estimate is set to 0h.
fields.summary: Epic Burndown Chart Should Honor Agile Board Estimation Time Tracking Preference

fields.description:
I have a Version Report, and I have set Start Date, and Scheduled Release Date on the version.
The graph that I get has the right side of the X-Axis cut-off on todays date. I was under the impression that this should be at least at the Scheduled Release Date value (even more the 10% prediction readiness mark).

This is a fug because all the other reports seem to respect the end-date of things (sprint, release, etc). This one doesn't.

PS. This is not a prediction fug. I realize that 10% progress has to be done before seeing it.
fields.summary: Version Report X-Axis should extend to the release end date, instead of capping out @ the current date

fields.description: Currently, when the permission on create/copy JIRA Agile board is based on *Create Shared Objects* global permission. However it does not have a specific permission on restricting user/group from copying the JIRA Agile board itself only.
fields.summary: restrict user to copy JIRA Agile board

fields.description:
First off, I'm not sure if this ticket belongs in the JIRA or Agile project, so I'm going for the more broad vision in that this is a JIRA problem.

When bulk editing tickets, if any of the tickets belong to a project that utilizes the Agile plugin, if the user leaves the Agile specific fields alone and submits changes to regular JIRA fields, the prior values in the Agile fields are removed.

This is very counter-intuitive when trying to apply point values to Sprint tickets during preparation of Sprints, and then when bulk closing out tickets the points values are removed. This makes quite a few Agile reports essentially useless due to the missing story point values.
fields.summary: Bulk edit of tickets removes Agile field values

Screen shot: http://note.io/1roPVx9

We have not been able to see the content of these epic tickets for the past few days. 

We have an ONdemand instance of Jira.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11086].
  {panel}

Tested in:
Chrome Version 36.0.1985.143
and
Safari Version 7.0.6 (9537.78.2)

The *Create Issue* Icon in Plan Mode in JIRA Agile located at the bottom of the screen cannot be clicked due to placement.  Cannot scroll to see it if the Board goes past the end of the screen.  Icon Is cut off (see screenshot)

As a Workaround:
Use the Browser *Zoom Out* function until the option is visible if the board is not too long, and the option becomes available
after clicking the option you can zoom back in and scroll to bottom to use inline mode if the Scrum Board filter is set to a single project. or a popup will come up if the filter is set to multiple projects.
fields.summary: Create Issue Icon cannot be clicked due to placement
Incorrect Documentation Linked in Popup For Inline Create Issue

On the other hand, Google Chrome doesn't present any problems.

I have attached HAR files showing the difference between Firefox and Chrome.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

In OnDemand/JIRA Cloud, after the maintenance window of 17/08/14 the "Issues in EPIC" column is no longer visible for customers who do not have a JIRA Agile subscription.

Previously this column was shown without a JIRA Agile subscription.

h3. Work around

If you need this panel to appear, you can activate a free trial of JIRA Agile.

Alternatively, to view the same information, you can use Issue Navigator to search for issues which belong to the epic, using JQL like the following:

{code}
"Epic Link" = <<NAME OR ISSUE KEY OF EPIC>>
{code}

h3. Fix

The fix will be to restore the functionality (Issues in Epic panel) even when there is no active JIRA Agile license.
fields.summary: The "Issues in EPIC" column is no longer visible on OnDemand instances without Jira Agile subscription

fields.description:
When an issue transitions to the same status that it's currently in, the cycle time on the Control Chart report is no longer reported correctly.

This can be duplicated with a new Kanban board set up with the "new project" option and the default simplified workflow and columns:

1. Create an issue, wait 5 minutes
2. Move to Selected for Development, wait 5 minutes
3. Move to In Progress, wait 5 minutes
4. Use the regular JIRA interface or the "more actions" dialog to select the In Progress transition again, so that the issue transitions to the same state.
5. Move the issue to Done

On the Control Chart report, the time spent In Progress is now lost.

The steps above aren't likely to happen, but the same thing happens if you have a custom workflow transition to toggle flags or fields on an issue, or if you are using transitions as a "poor man's field level security" as explained here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=149834

Note that after an issue has transitioned through a state once, this problem doesn't seem to occur anymore.

In our particular example, we have a transition on our Testing column to allow testers to update status; when they use this transition we lose all the initial time spent testing on the report.  We also have a global, recursive transition to allow limited field editing as described in the link above.  Whenever this is used on an active issue for the first time, it essentially erases all the time spent in that column.  As both these steps are used frequently in our workflow, this makes the control chart basically useless to us.
fields.summary: Kanban board cycle time not calculated correctly if issue transitioned in place

fields.description:
When an administrator user attempts to move an issue within a sprint, the system rejects the change and throws the following error message in a modal: JIRA Agile cannot execute the rank operation. This board has recently been configured to use the Rank field. The system must be re-indexed before you can rank issues. Ask your administrator to perform a manual re-index.

-No administrative user made configuration changes involving rank.
-This is negatively impacting our sprint planning and execution.
-Steps taken to remedy: background re-index (several times), log out and log back in.
fields.summary: Issues cannot be moved within a sprint due to ranking constraint

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Since the latest OnDemand Release (JIRA Agile 6.5.20), the Agile Wallboard Gadget stopped working.

When adding that gadget and configuring it (choosing the board, quick filters and refresh interval), clicking on "Save" does nothing: 

!Screen Shot 2014-08-19 at 11.58.46 AM.png!

Checking the dashboard, a blank gadget is displayed:

!Screen Shot 2014-08-19 at 11.51.01 AM.png!

h3. Symptoms

* JIRA Agile Wallboard gadget does not load
* Errors in the browser Javascript console

{noformat}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'extend' of undefined com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-dialog.js?locale=en-US:6
Uncaught TypeError: undefined is not a function com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-rapid.js?locale=en-US:4147
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getMode' of undefined com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-rapid.js?locale=en-US:4087
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'setPerViewValue' of undefined 
{noformat}

h3. Work around

Unfortunately there is no work around at this time. In the absence of a working Wallboard Gadget, if you need to access a particular board and can do so outside of a Dashboard, please use that instead. "Projector mode" (press the Z key twice) helps to remove the outer chrome of the board page to maximise the viewing area on a wallboard.
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard stopped working

fields.description:
When a user clicks on the "View on Board" link in any issue in JIRA, it times out and gives a Communication Breakdown popup.

When you click on "View on Board", it goes to all existing Rapid Boards, to look for which all boards this issue exists on, and is supposed to popup a screen with a list of all those JIRA Agile board(s) where the issue appears. 

However, it is reaching a time out, and the user receives a Communication Breakdown message.

What solutions are available to us?

Currently it is only possible to define the burndown chart criterium in the board configuration globally, which will affect the reports like velocity chart or burndown chart. Ideally it would be possible to switch this while viewing the different charts, taking the one in the board configuration as a default.

To achieve the same, i currently have to create a clone of the original board and then change the criterium there. This is of course is feasible, but gets a little frustrating, when you add/remove e.g. quck filters, swimlanes etc, as you have to do this to all the clones. As there is not such thing as "private" boards or marking boards as favorites, it also gets a little confusing after some time, when someone searches for a certain board.

Unable to rank New issues

fields.description:
We have been using and depend on version hierarchy for as long as we've used Jira/Greenhopper/Agile (about 3 years now). It continues to work for now but I keep seeing references saying the Classic Board is going away. The only thing we still use on the Classic Board is defining the version hierarchy as we add new versions. I typically get a page timeout when I navigate to the Classic Board so I can only assume it's seldom used.

I'll explain our release cycle to give context. We release a major product version every 4 months (version 21 is active and 22 is under development). Each product version cycle contains about six 2 week feature sprints, several hardening sprints, release/upgrade for customer instances, and then about 4 to 7 patches to production instances until that major version gets replaced with next major version. We have a unique minor version number for each of these builds/releases that is a child to the major version number.

Without version hierarchy, a whole bunch of our filters that reference parent versions will stop working and become impractical. In other words, these queries would need to reference many versions instead of just the parent version. In addition, we often target issues first to a major release and subsequently to a child version (release build) as the more detail planning occurs. Without the version hierarchy, this practice will most likely become overly complex and no longer work. Yes, we do use Agile boards but mostly for high level enhancement/feature planning and not for all the defects and other gritty details.

Is the version hierarchy capability and behavior going to be migrated to core Jira? still part of Agile?  Now that sprints and fixVersion have been separated it seems logical to move it to core Jira. I sure hope version hierarchy doesn't just disappear one day when Atlassian puts a new release out to AOD.

I've dug through the documentation (and Answers) and all I see is statements saying the Classic Board is going away. That's fine as long as the current version hierarchy behavior continues to be supported. Can I get a definitive answer as to the product plans related to this.
fields.summary: Need version hierarchy after Classic Board goes away

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The red line indicating the percentage of stories without estimates in the Version Report is always flat at 0, regardless of the actual data.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Version;
# Assign both estimated and unestimated issues to the Version;
# View the JIRA Agile Version Report.

h3. Expected Results
The 'Percent Unestimated Issues' (red line) indicates the percentage of issues in the Version that don't have an estimate.

h3. Actual Results
The line is always flat at 0.

h3.Notes
The unestimated issues are still listed correctly under the chart.

!Screen Shot 2014-08-14 at 15.55.43.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h5.steps to reproduce 1
# associate the _Sprint_ field with a screen used for creating/editing subtasks;
# configure multiple tabs in the screen;
# position the _Sprint_ field at the bottom of a tab;
# attempt to create or edit a subtask.

*Result:* all fields are displayed in one tab, with an indent indicating different tabs; clicking tabs to switch doesn't have any effect - [^sprint1.png], [^sprint2.png].

h5.steps to reproduce 2
# associate the _Sprint_ field with a screen used for creating/editing subtasks;
# position the _Sprint_ field above a system field, e.g. _Component_, _Fix Version_, _Summary_;
# attempt to create or edit a subtask.

*Result:* _Sprint_ field will be displayed over the next field in order - [^sprint7.png].

h6.Special case
If another field with the name "Sprint" is configured in the same screen, and both fields are positioned next to each other, with the locked one on top, they're somewhat merged:  [^sprint5.png], [^sprint6.png].

Same screens for non subtasks are working correctly.

fields.summary: Unable to Bulk Edit Sprint in JIRA Issues
Error displayed in custom field value when using the bulk update feature

fields.description: I can currently set a WIP limit on a column. When a user violates this, the column tells them this, and allows them to continue to place items into the column. I would like to have the ability to prevent the issue from being transitioned into the column until there is enough space in the WIP limit to handle this issue.
fields.summary: As a scrum master, I would like to enforce WIP limits

fields.description:
As a user who is viewing the board in Work mode, I want to see sub-tasks on the board even when using Quick Filters. 

I have a project board that has a number of quick filters for different Epics. My team wants to see the sub tasks on the board that roll up to a story that is part of an epic. So for example there is Epic A and we have a quick filter to show only work that is part of Epic A. Story B is part of Epic A.  Story B with several sub tasks. When we use the quick filter for Epic A the sub tasks do not display even though they are part of a story that is part of Epic A. We want to see the sub-tasks on the board and not have them be hidden by the Quick Filter.
fields.summary: Display sub-tasks on the Work mode of the board when using Quick Filters

fields.description:
Hi.. Im trying to build Jira Agile 6.4.3 to implement performance features suggested in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-9611.

However, I ran into this problem while doing so.Im not able to build Jira Agile from source.
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6765

Can you please provide missing dependencies 
com.atlassian.studio:studio-common-components-plugin:jar:1.6.6
com.atlassian.studio:studio-theme-core:jar:1.8.10
fields.summary: Request to provide missing dependencies to build Jira Agile from source

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11025].
  {panel}

h5.steps to reproduce
# Bulk Edit issues;
# select _Edit Issues_;
# try to edit the "Sprint" field.

*Result:*

fields.summary: An error occurs whilst rendering "Sprint" box for Bulk Update Edit page

fields.description:
Example:
- Custom fields provided by JIRA Toolkit Add-on are not available for selection when configuring a Board's Issue Detail View
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user I would like to configure the detail view for an issue to show custom fields provided by add-ons

fields.description:
AS A developer using jira having transitioned a ticket from one state in a workflow to the next I WANT the issue to appear at the bottom of the queue SO THAT we can maintain first in first out for each step in the kanban or scrum work board

AS A system admin I WANT to add a post function to some workflows that will rank an issue to the bottom of the queue when it transitions states SO THAT in a work board (kanban or agile) when issues move out of one state, they queue up at the bottom of the next state by default, rather than current behaviour of apparent 'random' insertion (based on global rank).

AS A system admin I WANT a global parameter to 'Set rank to bottom upon any state change" SO THAT I can make that the system-wide default behavior

AS A project admin I WANT a project parameter to 'Set rank to bottom upon any state change" SO THAT I can make that the project-wide default behavior, or override the system-default behavior

Current behavior of 'random-ish' insertion could almost be considered a bug/defect for Kannan teams..

version: whatever is on OnDemand at 8/8/2014

For example, if we have the following linear workflow states:
- New -> Ready for Specification -> Specification -> Ready for Design -> Design -> Breakdown -> Estimation -> Ready for Development -> Development -> Review -> Resolved -> Documentation -> Closed

When something moves from 'Ready for Desgin' into 'Desgin', it should be at the bottom of the design queue. When it moves from Estimation to Ready for Development, it should be at the bottom of the Ready for Development queue.

This is not ALWAYS the desired behavior, especially if one has taken pains to set a global priority, but in some teams focusing on flow this works well.
fields.summary: Issue post function to "rank to bottom" upon status change

fields.description:
1) Open an Agile Board with more than 1 Issue listed.
2) Place your mouse over the link for an Issue that is NOT currently the selected row in the board.  The underline should appear.
3) Right-click the link.

Expected result:
The typical right-click menu for a browser appears, allowing the user the option to open that link in a new tab/browser, as was likely their intent by right-clicking.

Actual result:
The right-click appears to be highjacked and turned into a left-click.  The issue is loaded in the right-hand side and the row in the board becomes selected.  Now that the row is selected, right-click works as expected.
fields.summary: Right-click Issue Link in Agile Board doesn't bring up right-click menu

fields.description:
As a team, we work on a mix of stories and bugs.  

Some individual bugs can take a long time to resolve (multiple sprints).  Is it possible to determine the amount of time logged to a ticket *in a certain time period * (typically, the last sprint).

Current reports show total amount of time spent (e.g. Workload pie chart gadget), but I'd like to be able to also see e.g. "time spent on bugs in the last sprint"

Possible?
fields.summary: Can I determine the time logged to a ticket, in a particular timeframe?
User can crash JIRA if SummaryIssueStatsCollector load too many issues

fields.description:
Subtask support in the planning view of scrum boards is terrible.

 - you can't easily see that the subtasks exist, nor to whom they're assigned
 - their estimation is added to overall time, but not to the time of the individual stories
 - they get hidden if you use a quick filter that hides the story, even if it shouldn't hide the sub-task

I want to be able to use subtasks because two levels or organization (epic/story) is frequently not enough. I don't see how anyone can affectively use them and I regret it pretty much every time I try.

I'm sure I'm duplicating other tickets here, but it's hard to tell which ones are considered active and which aren't. 

</rant>
fields.summary: Subtasks are unusable in Jira Agile Planning Board

fields.description:
The sprint dates in JIRA Agile have a funny format which is not recognized by some JIRA components.
When attempting to change the value it seems to be muddled up or saved in an incompatible format (see attached screenshots).

The gadget 'days left in sprint' is also not working due to this 'bug'.
fields.summary: Sprint Dates funny format

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10998].
  {panel}

h3. Actual Case

When the *Default Screen* is used as transition screen, the *field "sprint"* will be removed from the *view issue screen* and the issue will be lost from the *agile board* when the user with *no schedule permission* perform the workflow transition.

This also happen after *issue editing* by user with *no schedule permission* as well when the *editing issue screen* include the *sprint* field.


h3. Work Around
Use screen without the *sprint field*.
fields.summary: Users without schedule issue permission blow away sprint details when screen with the field "Sprint" is in used.

fields.description:
More often than not, customers find it very hard to figure out why their issues are not showing up on the Rapid board.

It would be great if we can have an admin helper that helps determine why an issue is not showing up on the Rapid board.
fields.summary: Create an admin helper to figure out why issues are not showing up on Rapid board

fields.description:
When using the Agile Board in work mode and viewing an issue's detail, myself and my teammates very frequently miss details of the tickets because they appear outside of the scrolled area, and there is no visual indication that the details are scrolled.

See attached screenshot: You can see here how it would be very easy to miss the "details" section above "comments".

I know that there's the detail nav tabs on the left hand side of the detail pane, but there's just not enough visual tie in with the rest of the details to notice it.

Even just a simple line or shadow that appeared at the upper edge of the scrollable area when scrolled would be enough.
fields.summary: JIRA agile does not give enough visual cues for scrolling side pane in 'work' view
